__e: He wants me to go to New York for a private meeting about my father's will.
I must tell you then. You have forgot the will I told you of.
I came to update her will, she's up with the doc, says he fell?
As if the idea of a will never crossed your mind?
You listen to me. You're after me for some reason and all I'm trying to do is point out that that will doesn't prove a thing.
I'm not saying a will isn't important. I'm saying it's a beautiful day.
It was in his will, which is the same answer that I gave you seven years ago.
I know his will favours you, as it is presently written.

But what should I do about the new will he wants me to sign?
Okay, you should really have a will that's more than one sentence long.
